newsitem.title: UK: London shares end mixed, firm bonds lend support.
newsitem.headline: London shares end mixed, firm bonds lend support.

text.p: UK shares closed little changed on Thursday, struggling for direction in thin, end-of-quarter trading but receiving support from higher bonds after further signs the U.S. economy was not as strong as thought.
The FTSE 100 ended down 2.5 points at 3,933.2, with decliners in a nine-to-two majority. Volume reached a modest 531.9 million by the close.
Dixons dragged down retailers as director share sales sparked profit-taking and Guinness fell amid worries over spirits sales.
But traders said the market was mostly on hold with few taking fresh positions before the end of the third quarter.
